greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of compositions of n such that the smallest part has multiplicity nine.
link: Joerg Arndt and Alois P. Heinz, Table of n, a(n) for n = 9..1000
mathematica: b[n_, s_] := b[n, s] = If[n == 0, 1, If[n<s, 0, Expand[Sum[b[n-j, s]*x, {j, s, n}] ]]]; a[n_] := With[{k=9}, Sum[Function[{p}, Sum[Coefficient[p, x, i]*Binomial[i+k, k], {i, 0, Exponent[p, x]}]][b[n-j*k, j+1]], {j, 1, n/k}]]; Table[ a[n], {n, 9, 40}] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Feb 09 2015, after Maple *)
results.author: _Joerg Arndt_ and _Alois P. Heinz_, Apr 30 2014
